website_summaries.verdict: Versatile enough for chocolate and cheese fondue use, the Nostalgia delivers the heated product by mechanical action, not a electric pump. We like its smaller profile, and it's price point and easy-to-clean design make it a great budget choice.
pros: Uses a mechanical auger to draw chocolate, not electric pump
Can also serve as a cheese fountain
cons: Auger assembly can be very noisy during operation

customer_reviews.title: ... of those products where you wonder where all the bad reviews came from and why those people are making ...
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping after reading the comments that this would be one of those products where you wonder where all the bad reviews came from and why those people are making stuff up but they were correct. Needed it for a bridal shower. It was 85 degrees and a light breeze. We made sure to use oil...actually added MORE oil after it decided to work for the first 2 minutes then it looked like a frozen over fountain you see in cold places....it just didn't work...and paying to return something that was 30$ just seems like more of a hassle than 20$ so it will be in my garage...in a box. Just look for another option.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: This was definitely a hit!!
customer_reviews.text: I was very nervous about setting up this fountain as I have never done anything like that before. I used milk chocolate made for a fountain that I got at Walmart, see the picture above. The instructions say to use a 2 pound bag, but I ended up using a little more than that just so there was enough to make it flow nicely. As you can see in the picture, it turned out wonderful! Everyone loved it! It was hard not to make a mess though. But hey, it's fun! I will definitely be using it again! I would definitely suggest cleaning it while the chocolate is still melted, that was the hardest part!
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Great for ranch fountain!
customer_reviews.text: I used this item for a ranch and Catalina fountain for pizza. Worked pretty well, I was the bride and not able to thin it out as much as I would have liked to achieve a more even flow, but I chose these bc you can run these machines without the heater. Great for the price, no issues with the machines and they ran for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Pearce

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made! Save you money!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give less than 1 star I would. Do not buy this! Cheaply made, plastic parts, poor customer service. The base has a switch to keep the melted chocolate warm, it isn’t strong enough to heat the bottom of the unit because the melted chocolate hardens in the base, causing it to be unable to funnel up and create the fountain effect. The melting chocolate I used is specifically for a chocolate fountain. The consistency is liquid enough to use in a fountain, however this is not a quality product and when I called customer service they were not helpful at all. Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: Pamelarun

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for Daddy Daughter Dance
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for our local Daddy Daughter Dance and while it does take the chocolate a little while to warm up, once it gets going this thing works great. It is nosy in the video and does make some noise, but once you put people and music in a room, you can't hear this at all. We had several hundred for the dance and as long as you have someone to keep filling this with melted chocolate, this thing will keep on trucking. We will likely order another one for next year, the little girls LOVED it! And the price is great!
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Kress

customer_reviews.title: The only issue was that I had to fill it pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Was a huge hit for a family fondue night! The only issue was that I had to fill it pretty quickly... not because it was out of chocolate because there was plenty in the basin but the fountain stopped fully working unless it had a certain quantity in it... which resulted in a lot of extra chocolate at the end that I didn't use. It was easy to set up and clean. It had no working issues the first time out as long as it had plenty of chocolate in it.
customer_reviews.author: Wendi

customer_reviews.title: I had a party for my coworkers and this were the worse fountains I’ve ever used
customer_reviews.text: Today was the first time I’ve used these fountains. I had a party for my coworkers and this were the worse fountains I’ve ever used. They were super loud. Splattered chocolate all over the table and the chocolate flowed unevenIy. I followed the directions and still a mess. I would love to get a refund for them. I do not recommend to anyone. Sephra brands are a whole lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, easy to use and dripping deliciousness
customer_reviews.text: I love this chocolate fountain. It was quiter than expected and really quite easy to set up and clean. When using it be sure to put a disposable table cloth underneath it because you will make a mess with drippy chocolate everywhere, especially if using it with kids. My 6 yr old was literally covered in chocolate but it was worth the mess. We will bring it out for many special occasions to come. I used the chocolate wafers that didn't require you to add oil and they worked just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Used it three times already. Easy to clean and easy to operate. I malted chocolate bark and thinned it out with lots of coconut oil to get it working. It takes a little over 2 lbs and the Wilton chocolate for chocolate fountains works best, but if you need a cheaper option chocolate bark works too.
customer_reviews.author: sstiteler2

customer_reviews.title: The hit of the party!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I purchased this chocolate fountain for my daughter's sweet 16 party! It was definitely the hit of the party. Set up and assembly was super easy. I followed the extra tip to let it run for 5 min after adding the melted chocolate, shut the motor off for 30 sec and turn back on. It gets rid of any air bubbles and flows smoothly all around. It ran for 4 hours with no problem. There is a bit of sound from the motor, but once the kids started talking and music started playing, you could not hear it at all. It's a bit messy to clean, but not difficult. It was definitely worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kari P.

customer_reviews.title: Be weary of using for an event...
customer_reviews.text: Used this for queso, used the right amount of (real) cheese, and added lots of milk to thin it out, no chunks of veggies. I added the cheese piping hot and preheated the unit for a solid 10 minutes, it didn’t feel hot, but I had faith I was just being critical. Cheese flowed for maybe 15 minutes but it hardened up and just stopped flowing. I’m not sure if it’s the unit I have or what, but it ruined the whole purpose of this for a bridal shower. Super disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Works at first, then.. Cold, doesn’t warm, clumps up.
customer_reviews.text: I DO NOT recommend this fountain. I’ve tried it 2 or 3 times with nacho cheese. I even used milk to thin out the cheese. I cooked/warmed the cheese up first then added to the fountain. It works great for about 10-15 minutes and then becomes very cold and starts to harden. Once the cheese becomes cold, it no longer flows through the fountain. I imagine the same thing will happen with chocolate, as this cheese was thinner than chocolate after I added milk. The fountain has a warmer, and the metal plate feels warm to the touch, but the cheese is still COLD.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle A.

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely purchase again!!
customer_reviews.text: Used for a sweet table and it functioned perfectly. My only complaint was the fact that I had to pour chocolate in and out 3 different times, reheat, add oil and put back bc it wouldn’t flow properly bc the chocolate was to think, bc I had to add so much veg. Oil for it to flow properly it then made the chocolate taste oily and gross. I used the recommended chocolate that was on an add when I purchased the fountain but after reading more reviews on other machines I will try a more expensive chocolate as they’ve suggested. But other than that I would def recommenced, especially for this price!!
customer_reviews.author: K.Turner

customer_reviews.title: disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this product. However, as soon as I pulled it out of the box, part of the plastic cracked. When I set the base on the counter, I realized it was warped and uneven. Despite those things, I decided to try it anyway. I followed the instructions and made sure the chocolate was very warm. It worked pretty well for a few minutes, and then the chocolate started getting clumpy and the chocolate flow slowed. So, the heating element doesn't work. All in all--don't waste your money. I threw out the box the chocolate disappointment arrived in, so I'm not even sure I can return it at this point. :(
customer_reviews.author: Love2readamazon

customer_reviews.title: Great treat.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a Covid graduation to bring some sweetness to small family event. Easy to set up. the only trick was to start heat the machine about 15min prior to using. After melting the wafers and pouring in, the full chocolatey covering didint happen til 20- 30min later. The top 1sr two tiers were covered but the larger bottoms ones took that amount of time to be covered. Not really an issue but more or a novice mistake. Cleaned easily with tissue to get out the last chocolate and wet soapy sponge to clean the residue. Disassembled the other pieces and soaked then in hot soapy water filled container. Rinsed 10minlater. Dried n stored for next time.
customer_reviews.author: Raul Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t live up to expectations.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a party. Other reviewers stated it worked for ranch dressing just fine. Actually, false ish. You have to water it down but getting the right consistency is tricky. If the motor & auger functioned at a higher rate it would work just fine. We had a second one used as a chocolate fountain. We did pre melt the chocolate but this unit couldn’t keep the chocolate warm enough for it to flow right even with the built in heat function on. Probably best to just purchase a higher quality unit.
customer_reviews.author: scabard27

customer_reviews.title: Very cool!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a New Years Eve party and it was a huge hit! However, make sure you buy like 4-5 bags of chocolate chips to get the fountain to run smooth without gaps in the waterfall feature. It’s a bit noisy but outside of that, we will def use this at many more parties to come! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: S. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Tips to keep in mind
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an event and tried it out first. You absolutely must add oil to the melting chocolate, even though the chocolate I purchased said it was not necessary. Very difficult to clean the basin. You need to wipe it out with paper towels and toss those in the trash, otherwise you will have a clogged sink! Knowing this ahead of time would make the purchase more worth it. I learned the hard way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chocolate fountain was a hit at grad party!
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with this product! It was one of the highlights of our daughter's grad party! Everyone loved it! The chocolate that we ordered for it was not the best. I would buy the chocolate discs from Walmart next time but the fountain was a hit! Everyone was commenting on it. We had fruits, cookies, pretzels and crackers to dip. This was totally worth the money and we will use it the next time we have a party. Our friends even want us to bring it to their house for their next party!
customer_reviews.author: online shopper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my daughter’s bridal shower!!!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this little fountain.! Worked great! Make sure to buy the proper chocolate. And make sure it is totally melted before pouring into fountain. Microwave in large GLASS bowl as directed on package. It was pretty easy to put together. Cleaning was kind of a pain. Just soak well with Dawn soap to get all the grease residue from the chocolate. GOOD LUCK! AND HAVE FUN!!!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Tait

customer_reviews.title: Fountain fun
customer_reviews.text: Chocolate fountain used for a “friends” themed party..... we utilized it as part of the decor as it served as the “fountain” that the characters all stood in during the intro. We then put cute little drink umbrellas by the fountain and had anything you could think to dip in Chocolate available. Worked great, kept the flow of chocolate smooth for hours, is not super loud, it does have a humm to it, but it is not overly annoying. Clean up was easy, although it would be better to clean them when the chocolate is still soft, not days later like I did!!!
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money with this product
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy this product. Bought the first one it was delivered with a default. Returned and bought a second one which did not work. Absolute waste of time, money and effort. If possible would give it zero stars. Stay away from this brand. Paid more and bought a Wilton brand which works great.
customer_reviews.author: TRF

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic. Not convenient. Hard to clean.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not impressed. They could have made all the parts steel or aluminum and have the base be able to heat the chocolate. Because it's plastic it won't heat it and you need to have access to a microwave and heat it only to a certain temperature.... This all makes it clumsy and unusable on location. Cleaning it was such a mess that we just threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warmer doesn’t get hot enough.
customer_reviews.text: The warmer didn’t keep the chocolate warm enough, so it kept getting clumpy. The flow was great at the beginning. Made a big mess which the kids loved. The amount of oil needed to thin the chocolate down changed the flavor of the chocolate too much for my one son. We also tried it as a cheese fountain same thing it flowed well for the first little bit. But, within a few minutes it was clumpy.... we had better luck take the cheese out and putting it in a dish re warmed it once and it never got clumpy again. Flowing it cooled everything down to quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Tried queso- ready to try more
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fountain to use as a queso feature for my son’s graduation. My boy loves queso!! I read the description and reviews of several models, this one made the best sense for experimenting with melted cheese! It wasn’t a total success, but we did have a functioning fountain after some tweaking. The cheese has to be very diluted with milk and that’s not the real problem. The problem is that the dish with the heating element doesn’t heat warm enough to keep the cheese flowing. Maybe the center tube should be metal and heated to keep the flow of thicker sauces. I imagine ranch and bbq would have to be diluted as well.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy B.

customer_reviews.title: Keep it on plastic or use a plastic table cloth. The chocolate is thin and drips.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the ease of setup. Cleanup was sort of hard. Make sure you use a plastic table cloth or lay some plastic wrap down around it or you’ll have issues with the spillage. Also follow the directions carefully for making the melted chocolate. Mine was a bit too thick the first time and needed to be emptied and remixed. Otherwise, everyone loved this. It was great to have everyone crowded around with their sticks and enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: HEADLINE:::::;: MAN BUYS SOMETHING FOR WIFE, STILL GETS IN TROUBLE
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if 3 stars is fair... But this product did get me in trouble with the misses. She's on a diet so i guess that means no liquid cheese (her being from Wisconsin ) and no chocolate (me wanting chocolate). At $10 to return , it would make a great whatever gift for someone's first marriage.
customer_reviews.author: andy dubitsky

customer_reviews.title: Better than excepted
customer_reviews.text: Runs a lot better when the chocolate is thinner. I bought this one and another one from the store for a large birthday party. For presentation this out performed the stores brand, was quieter and even with the same chocolate in both this one had a more even distribution of chocolate over the tiers. In the attached video it’s the one on the right and the left is the store brand.
customer_reviews.author: Tenille

customer_reviews.title: it's alright...
customer_reviews.text: I have not used it much but the first time I used it it did not go so well, it does not get too hot, the chocolate does not last long melted and You have to put a lot of melted chocolate to make it look pretty. hopefully the next time that i use it change My expectation about this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother even trying it.
customer_reviews.text: This was a complete dud just like the rest of the 1 star reviews, don't bother with this model, all my 4 year old wanted for her birthday was a chocolate fountain, well it kinda worked for a few minutes so that was good enough but wow it's just junk
customer_reviews.author: Lost R.

customer_reviews.title: Good chocolate fountain for the price
customer_reviews.text: I used this during my daughter's birthday party and it was a crowd favorite. I used 2lbs of the Sephra chocolate chips with it and it flowed beautifully. It was easy to assemble and the noise level was low. It is a little difficult to clean since chocolate is not too easily wiped off. I still recommend it for private use. Good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't heat
customer_reviews.text: It functions okay except for one aspect, the heater. The base certainly heats up but it won't keep your food warm. Added hot nacho cheese and, partially due to the disbursement of heat as it cascades and partially due to the lame heating element, we had cold cheese in no time. Might not be huge deal for chocolate but nobody wants cold cheese.
customer_reviews.author: sunshine sparks

customer_reviews.title: You need this!
customer_reviews.text: If you are thinking of purchasing a chocolate fountain, I highly recommend doing so. We had so much fun with this one at Christmas. I was nervous about the clean up but shouldn’t have been. Super easy and dishwasher safe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this, I would say just buy the candy melts made for these. I did it both ways melting chocolate chips and the candy melts and it was a world of difference!!!
customer_reviews.author: AleciaM

customer_reviews.title: Great fountain! Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This fountain worked perfectly! Just took a few minutes to assemble. We pre melted the chocolate and warmed up the machine as per the directions. We used regular Nestle chocolate chips from Sams club, and it was great. The leveling feet are a good feature. Cleanup was a little bit of a chore but nothing crazy. It would’ve been nice if the parts were dishwasher safe, but it’s definitely not a deal breaker. It was a big hit with everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Lolazu26

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to assemble & clean. Had a party with about 275 people for my dads 70th birthday. Reading reviews everyone mentioned they used it for a particular size party but I didn’t see any about how much chocolate to buy. I purchased 2 bags of chocolate through Amazon. That was not enough to make the chocolate stream down the fountain (like the picture). It more so dripped. I believe 3 bags would have done it.
customer_reviews.author: AYB

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as described
customer_reviews.text: Description says you can use with cheese. Purchased for party and placed cheese sauce in unit. Thinned cheese with milk and turned on. Cheese did work for about 10 minutes. This is supposed to have a heater to keep chocolate or cheese warm so it will work. Heater did not work. Cheese got hard and clogged unit. Hard to try to scoop cheese out and place in small crock pot. Could not clean and had to throw entire fountain away. SAVE YOU MONEY AND TIME.... just buy a small crock pot and enjoy your day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed but going to try one more time
customer_reviews.text: We used it for nacho cheese for a taco buffet and it didnt do well with the cheese at all. Was clumpy and never flowed like a fountain. I was disappointed. Its too late to refund but we are going to attempt 1 more time with chocolate for a graduation party 🤞 hopefully it works and wasnt a total waste of $
customer_reviews.author: J.Gon.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for my wedding
customer_reviews.text: It's bigger than i expected it was the size i was hoping for so I'm glad i went with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Jennica Powers

customer_reviews.title: critical part was missing from the package
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for Valentine's Day and was pretty excited about surprising my girlfriend with it. Low and behold, when I began assembling it, I realized that the central black rotor that actually pumps the chocolate through the fountain was missing. I was very careful taking out all the parts from the box, and I dug though the packaging for 30 minutes to make sure I didn't miss anything. After that, I crawled around the kitchen and checked under everything - no rotor. Very disappointed with this fountain, really hope that no one else has the same experience I did.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Gulley

customer_reviews.title: Awesome !!
customer_reviews.text: I was super nervous about buying this chocolate fountain because the price was so cheap. I bought it for my wedding and it is awesome! Easy to put together and easy to clean. I didn't use a special chocolate I just used chocolate chips and oil and it worked great!! We bought another one because we were so impressed so that we can use to different kinds of chocolate at my wedding.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Bentley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition to a Sweet 16 party
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my daughters birthday and loved every minute of it. Flowed great, not nosey overall, seemed a bit more noticeable once the chocolate got near being gone. 2 biggest suggestions, put something under it as it's easy to drip coming out of the fountain, and wash immediately once you are done using it with warm water, that made the cleaning very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Straight Up

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Easy Care
customer_reviews.text: I've used this at two parties now and it's been a hit at both. I found it fairly simple to set up and also to clean. It's not difficult to clean, just takes a little patience and time. You can have it clean in about 15 minutes. I'm very pleased with my purchase and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: S Kendrick

customer_reviews.title: First Time User!!! Will ALWAYS Use!
customer_reviews.text: LOOOOOVE this item. It works soooo good. It's smooth and doesn't make much noise. At any event it would be silent under the sound of a DJ.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Monique

customer_reviews.title: pretty messy
customer_reviews.text: you need a lot of chocolate to fill it up so it doesnt splatter everywhere. and it gets very very messy. not recommended for indoor use... unless you put something down to catch the chocolate tht splurts everywhere. going to use one more time with more chocolate and if not ill return this messy thing.
customer_reviews.author: Zeke Moore

customer_reviews.title: Chocolate Fountain the Hit of Every Party!
customer_reviews.text: The chocolate fountain was a complete hit at the baby shower I threw for my cousin! Everyone commented on how fun it was to use. Our family has pulled it out for birthday parties and one family game night. I used 1.5 cups of canola oil mixed with 2 12 ounce packages of chocolate chips. It works like a charm, and is a delight to use!
customer_reviews.author: Aimee J. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: For the price, works very well.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a graduation party, and it definitely worked well for the 3 hours needed. It took us a few minutes to get it level, but after putting a folded paper towel underneath one end, the chocolate came out smoothly on all sides. Every time we added more chocolate to the bottom it took two people just because it was a bit tricky pouring it in the bottom as the bowl isn't overly large. Bought the recommended chocolate, and it was enjoyed by all- very tasty.
customer_reviews.author: KayLu

customer_reviews.title: Nice little chocolate fountain for any occasions
customer_reviews.text: Ohmygeee this thing is so perfect in my baby’s first birthday. It wasn’t even that loud and works just fine once you follow the instructions, on how to make it work properly. Make sure the surface is balance so chocolate will flow flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Arian03

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for sons wedding
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for my sons wedding. I used 2 bags of the Wilton chocolate and added a little oil (I don’t care what the bag says. It flows ways better with a little oil. I preheated the fountain for 10 minutes. I then turned on the fountain as I poured the chocolate into the bowl. The flow was okay. After a few minutes , turn off the fountain and let the bubbles rise to the top. Then turn on the fountain again and get a perfect flow. Mine looked as good as the picture the whole evening.
customer_reviews.author: Collyn Soo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine
customer_reviews.text: Perfect It does the job really well I had party for 25 people at home and they love this product I put in a bags of chocolate (4 pounds total ) I use the brand SEPHRA that I purchase here on Amazon I just toss the bag in the microwave and follow the instructions I put a little vegetable oil after words to make the machine work better , the funny part is that I though that 4 pounds wasn't unough then I purchase for Moore on the same place that I rented the chairs and other things but I dint use all . Four pounds was more than enough, excellent Maxine
customer_reviews.author: Faridi

customer_reviews.title: Cheese fountain! Doesn’t keep cheese warm
customer_reviews.text: Super cute for a nacho cheese fountain! It did not warm the cheese, and also all of the fountain pieces were not covered with cheese. But this was a great hit at my wedding shower!
customer_reviews.author: Brit

customer_reviews.title: Did not work smh
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my goddaughter special big 1st birthday party that was today. I bought this a few months ago and waited to use it until this special day. I put it together as directed, melted fountain friendly chocolate chips (3 bags) & it didn't work!!!!!!!! it ruined the whole sweet table cause this was gonna be used for party favors, fruit, etc I got so pissed off I threw the fountain/chocolate it all away because it was not safe it had a burning smell!!! I'm out the cost of this fountain plus three bags 17.99 x 3 because you sold me a faulty product. VERY DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.author: Marcella Behi

customer_reviews.title: Everyone loved the concept but the machine was really loud
customer_reviews.text: Everyone loved the concept but the machine was really loud, the chocolate didn’t stay warm which caused it to harden faster than I had expected. I will definitely be buying one because it was fun but not this one. Also, the chocolate stuck to everything making it very hard to cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: Mazzola

customer_reviews.title: Wobble baby wobble
customer_reviews.text: The top was not stable at all. I checked it 2-3 times just to make sure I had it on right which it was. I could not get that thing from being so wobbly. It's a great size but it just gave me a headache messing with it
customer_reviews.author: Rukiya Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this about 3 times now, only with chocolate, and it's been a hit! Make sure to follow the instructions on how to prepare the chocolate so that it is smooth enough and flows properly (that's the only thing I didn't get right the first time). Very impressed, especially for the price!!
customer_reviews.author: KAli

customer_reviews.title: Great for gatherings
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to assemble and our guess enjoyed it very much
customer_reviews.author: Luz

customer_reviews.title: Fun addition to a kids party
customer_reviews.text: We used this for my 10 year old daughter' party and it was the star attraction when it came to food. We had strawberries, marshamallows and pineapples for dipping. The set up was quite easy. Cleaning took a bit of an effort but nothing too bad. I used chocolate made specially for fountains.
customer_reviews.author: Zintleathergoods

customer_reviews.title: Very efficient, a little noisy, but great quality
customer_reviews.text: I have used this chocolate fountain 5 times since before Christmas. It's easy to set up and easy to clean up and everyone really enjoys it. It is a little noisy so i set it up in a different Room from where we want to converse. But people gather round it anyways. Make sure to level it like the instructions say.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Hoxworth

customer_reviews.title: Great fountain
customer_reviews.text: Works great ! My daughter enjoyed this for her bday
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Can't complain for the price
customer_reviews.text: We did a test run before the wedding. Easy to assemble. Getting it level is the trick! I used spectra dark chocolate. It said no oil, but putting 1/2 cup in 2 lbs made it flow nicer. I big difference, when it didn't add the oil. The bag said no oil needed. To take down is easy but sssssooooo messy. The tiers are plastic, the tub doesn't come out so use a brush to get in between then keep wiping. It's a novality won't be using often, but cheaper than hiring a vendor at the wedding.
customer_reviews.author: RNthatLUVSshoes

customer_reviews.title: Great product and it’s reliable
customer_reviews.text: Have used it 3 times for gatherings, parties, nurses week celebrations. Huge hit! Keeps the chocolate smooth and melted. Honestly any time you work with melted chocolate, it’s messy. But totally worth it for the joy it brings the guests.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend but difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: This was def the hit of my party. Worked well. Splashes a little. But worth the money. Easy to put together. Horrible to clean!! Use very Hot water and the chocolate comes right off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product, we used it at my son's grad party. We used more chocolate than directions said, so be prepared and have melted chocolate ready. Also, we were outside and it was windy enough to blow chocolate around onto the tablecloth, which wasn't a big deal. Can't wait to use it again...it was a hit!!
customer_reviews.author: elementary teacher

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Searched and researched for what brand model to buy ... as I waited until the last minute this was the only product available to ship in time ... BUT WHAT A GREAT MACHINE!!! Not all reviews direct you in the right way ... I’m glad I waited as it turned out this was the best value for my money .... easy to set up, simple directions ... it dat over night and it was still easy to clean ... good product for the money you spend ...
customer_reviews.author: MDT

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Last
customer_reviews.text: We loved this for the three times it worked. We only used it once a year, and the fourth time we tried to use it the motor didn't work at all. It's not an overly expensive fountain, but I expected it to work longer than 3 uses. 3 stars since it worked well until it gave up on us.
customer_reviews.author: Kirstin B

customer_reviews.title: I Have Regrets. Waste of $45
customer_reviews.text: This Product simply didn't work. I meant to return it... but I missed my return window. Now I'm stuck with this product that doesn't work. I followed the instructions. I melted the chocolate. The chocolate did not move though the fountain. It was embarrassing at my daughter's sleepover because this was one of the highlights of the party. The kids ended up using a spoon to drizzle their chocolate. Life moved on and I forgot to drop this box off at UPS. What a waste of money. Save yourselves.
customer_reviews.author: Cyn City

customer_reviews.title: Disastrous
customer_reviews.text: Trash. Did not work. Centerpiece of baby shower and an extreme disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Ms CG

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected for sure!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product! Worked perfectly right from the get go definitely a lot better quality product than I thought I was paying for which was a awesome surprise! And surprisingly even easy to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew T.

customer_reviews.title: Chocolate did not melt and got hard
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my daughters Birthday in February. she had her party at night and we had the Fondue Fountain outside but the chocolate started to get thick and then got hard. I think maybe the weather was too cold. I then brought it inside and cleaned it , had hard time removing hard rock chocolate and tried it again , this time didn't get rock hard but it didnt get smooth and soft either, was thick and machine made too much noise and wobbled. seems chocolate was to thick and heavy for machine because it doesn't get hot enough to really melt the chocolate. I haven used it since.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus

customer_reviews.title: Made me the cool mom
customer_reviews.text: Used for my daughter birthday party and I have officially won mom of the year. Or more realistically mom of the moment lol. Either way they kids had an absolute blast. I had no issues cleaning and I didn't notice the noise.
customer_reviews.author: L. Dean

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this!
customer_reviews.text: It burnt at first use, messy, not smooth, loud sounds, and motor didn’t work properly, it was a total disaster. Very cheap made fountain. Instruction didn’t help at all, not worth it for the money and the time. I don’t recommend anyone to buy this product for any occasions. Very disappointed. Not even heating up enough to clean the rest of chocolate. HORRIBLE!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price it’s a good buy. Kinda messy when cleaning but everyone loved it at the party! Don’t forget to add the oil to the chocolate. It makes it thin enough to flow.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica V

customer_reviews.title: works pretty well! louder than expected
customer_reviews.text: works pretty well! louder than expected, but with a house full of 25 people you couldn't hear it. i used a level to make sure the machine was straight before using, but still the chocolate layer at the bottom seemed to be angled inward. didn't have much affect on the taste, just the aesthetic.
customer_reviews.author: drew

customer_reviews.title: Leave some time ahead!
customer_reviews.text: It was very hard to get started and took a while for it to warm up enough to actually pump up to the top
customer_reviews.author: Perfectionk101

customer_reviews.title: Only good for one round
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for our first event! It was so messy to clean and when we tried to use it a second time the heating element broke so the chocolate never warmed up.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Tranhiep

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: It was disappointing for the price. It's tiny and the flow isn't smooth. I used the type of chocolate where no oil is needed so it couldn't be the chocolate mixture. It seems like it's lacking the power to push up the chocolate for fast and smooth flow.
customer_reviews.author: Lack Family Music

customer_reviews.title: Life of the Party!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I was skeptical about this fountain. It arrived the same day as my party so I didn't have much time to play with it before everyone arrived. I had read reviews about the noise and how it doesn't pump well etc. Well, they are all dumb. The thing runs very quietly and worked flawlessly. It was seriously the life of the party!
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Chocolate Fountain - Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed with this product. I have several other appliances of this brand and they work as well as expected or better. This fountain started out okay except the motor sounded really loud with an angry grinding noise. I guess that should have been a sign. I ignored the noise since it seemed to be working as it should. I thought well I bought it for a birthday party it just has to work for one night. Too bad that it didn't make it. Two hours into the party, it just quit. I guess the motor overheated or blew up. It hasn't worked since.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Martin

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: The buttons on the machine were not labeled correctly. The labels were reversed. The lettering on the machine rubbed off just by wiping the machine down. Struggled at times to keep up a steady flower of chocolate, but overall worked ok. It gets a 1 star because if you can't get your button correct what else is wrong with the machine. Also, machine looks cheap with letter already missing.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: Definitely the hit of the party! Everyone loved it and it was well priced. Just make sure you melt the chocolate with a little vegtable oil until it has a smooth shiney look to it.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Wedding bliss
customer_reviews.text: We bought one of these for my daughter's wedding reception. It was a real hit. We got chocolates from the hobby lobby and they melted up in the microwave really easily - the fountain did a great job keeping them liquidy. It was fantastic. Clean up was ok with some hot water and throwing the pieces in the dishwasher. I am very happy with this one and am considering buying one for home for fun on movie night. I was expecting a "disposable" product but was surprised by the quality. I didn't find it loud at all and it was simple to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: DR Davis

customer_reviews.title: Hit of the party
customer_reviews.text: Hit of the bridal shower. The girls just loved it paired it with Wilton chocolate, fruit and marshmallows. I had it on my center island and the noise level was really low you didn’t even hear it. Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Nunzmom

customer_reviews.title: The talk of the party!
customer_reviews.text: Super fun way to add some pizzazz to your parties. We had this at a graduation party and everyone loved it! Super easy to operate and clean up was fairly easy. We have used it at every gathering since then.
customer_reviews.author: R-L.Herndon

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: Chocolate did not come out evenly, it was flowing more the right. I had it on a steady even surface. I used Wilton chocolate. My guests ended up just dipping their treats in the bottom tier like a fondue pot, fountain was useless.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Avalos

customer_reviews.title: Huge hit at birthday
customer_reviews.text: Huge hit at my daughters birthday! Easy to use and easy to clean. Worked great! Would recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: Does its job
customer_reviews.text: There is a lingering sound the whole time it was on. My fountain is slanted to the side like 1-2 degrees so it's not noticeable but still a little annoying. I have used chocolate and cheese on it. Works good, just make sure the cheesy you choose is thinner otherwise it cools and gets stuck. Great buy and I get compliments all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Danely Cerrato

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend this product. I bought 2 fountains for my wedding for 8/8/20 and neither of them worked properly. They were both defective and did not warm the chocolate properly. Sadly the return window has closed already, and I now have to dispose of 2 fountains. It's a shame.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe C

customer_reviews.title: Good for parties with max 40 people.
customer_reviews.text: It is a little noisy but my family is talkative, so it doesnt really matter. I think that you need to just make sure you get the chocolate consistency right before you put it in the fountain. It's a pain to add oil after you've put the chocolate in. Overall, I'd say that it's been a hit everytime we've used it and I'm glad we got it! We've used it for parties that have around 30 people and have never had to refill it and always end up throwing some chocolate away.
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: Not the best, keep looking
customer_reviews.text: It functions,barely. It will warm the chocolate just enough to melt it and send it up the tube but not warm enough to keep the resivware in a flowing state. I would buy a much better brand. Dont skimp on the price like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Great price for this little fountain! Since I was using this a my bridal shower I did a test run first. I'm glad I did because you have to make sure you have the chocolate at the right consistency so it flows through the fountain correctly. I just needed to use a bit more oil. It flowed through a lot better at the shower and it was a hit! Everyone loved it and there was hardly any chocolate left! I would recommend this fountain for small parties or get togethers. I had about 20-25 people at my shower and it was the perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Veatch

customer_reviews.title: Yummy flowing chocolate...need I say more?
customer_reviews.text: Great tabletop fountain....used it at a halloween party...and it was a big hit! The only catch is you have to heat the chocolate before you put it in there. It WILL keep it warm and flowing, but the chocolate has to be melted before...so that was a little hiccup, but won't be next time...I'll be ready!
customer_reviews.author: Jan Adams

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This is nothing as far as size like the picture, extremely small and unsatisfactory Hated it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Works great for ranch!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my daughter's birthday party and used it for a ranch fountain. It worked great! You need to thin the ranch just a bit. It's a bit loud for a quiet event but was a big hit. Clean up is easy.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Nice presentation
customer_reviews.text: Of course the outcome treat is the best part- hard to clean though- I found myself at the end of the party spending 30 or more minutes cleaning all the parts..... but again the chocolate fountain was a hit!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Fun to have
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I would suggest melting the chocolate first as the wafers take a long time. Once they have melted they reheat well in the base, but remove fountain before letting it cool. The fountain was fun to use, but I enjoy the ease of just using the base also.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun
customer_reviews.text: We used this on Christmas Eve for a fondue party. I bought the more expensive chocolate and threw it out because it would not melt down. Went to chocolate chips and a little oil and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say enough good things about this chocolate fountain. It’s was just perfect! I used it for our softball teams senior night. I did adjust the feet to make the chocolate flow perfectly. I also used the chocolate in the bag for these type machines. I turned on the warmer about 10 min before adding the chocolate and it was absolutely perfect! Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie Garvey

customer_reviews.title: Loved It
customer_reviews.text: Loved It....Beautiful...Kids couldn't get enough of it, bought it for a function but item arrived after...just tried it out because I read the reviews...I'll buy another in future 🥰🥰🥰
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2 Stars - not the best
customer_reviews.text: Chocolate doesn’t really move enough to make it a fountain. We ended up using a spoon to try and get the chocolate to cascade between the tiers. It still didn’t work too well. Chocolate gets melted in the microwave before it’s put into the foundation.
customer_reviews.author: Kerri

customer_reviews.title: We loved it!
customer_reviews.text: I bough this for my 4 year old birthday party, it was easy to clean just with dawn and hot water. We had over 40 guests and it worked very well. I do recommend the Sephra chocolate because it’s easy to melt and it’s super delicious.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

product_meta.title: Nostalgia CFF986 32-Ounce Stainless Steel Chocolate Fondue Fountain, 2-Pound Capacity, Easy to Assemble 4 Tiers, Perfect For Nacho Cheese, BBQ Sauce, Ranch, Liqueurs
product_meta.description: Color:Stainless SteelThis head turner is a 4 tier fountain with stainless steel base that will impress guests with elegance and style at any special event. This chocolate fountain creates a cascade of sweetness that will add mouth watering fun to any occasion. Simply pour the recommended amount of melted white or dark chocolate into the base and switch on the motor. Watch as the chocolate is carried to the top of the tower where it flows down each tier in a mesmerizing display. Provide guests with fresh strawberries, marshmallows, pretzels, cookies, and other goodies for dipping. Cheese and barbeque sauces may also be used. Easily disassembles for quick cleanup. The fountain is a beautiful addition to any dining table or casual gatherings with friends and family.
feature_bullets: Fondue fun: 4-tier chocolate fountain has a 2-pound capacity, making this a party favorite – perfect for birthday parties, family gatherings, wedding and baby showers
Great for other sauces: This isn’t just a chocolate fountain – it’s perfect for nacho cheese, bbq sauce, ranch, liqueurs and more
Stainless look: The elegant stainless steel heated bowl keeps the sauces flowing so you get a consistent dip every time
Four tiers: The 4-tier fountain creates a beautiful cascading effect and is easy to assemble and disassemble, making setup and cleanup a breeze
Auger-style fountain: The auger-styled fountain (no pump) provides the continuous flow of chocolate
Gift-giving: Chocolate fountain is perfect for birthday parties, family gatherings, wedding and baby showers

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars2,234 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
